project.teaser: MARINEWIND is a 36 months coordination and support action that will identify bottlenecks and potential opportunities to strengthen floating offshore wind's technology FOWT role in delivering innovative solutions to system integration and will consider how best to integrate...
project.objective: MARINEWIND is a 36 months coordination and support action that will identify bottlenecks and potential opportunities to strengthen floating offshore wind's technology FOWT role in delivering innovative solutions to system integration and will consider how best to integrate such a system by exploring the market, policy and regulations issues, social, financial and techno-economic optimal solutions, and provision for storage and flexibility recommendations. The MARINEWIND methodology is based on the analysis of the MARINEWIND Labs, that are social, environmental, technological and financial pilot studies based upon a multi-faceted data collection and analysis on barriers and enablers related to: a) policy measures (WP1); b) societal engagement and environmental impact (WP2); c) financial solutions, techno-economic implications and commercialization of FOWT (WP3). The MARINEWIND Labs are located in five countries: Portugal and UK (actual applications of FOWT) and Greece, Spain and Italy (planned applications of FOWT). These Labs will support the transfer of knowledge from the established experiences to the potential FOWT sites where plans for installation of FOWT are still at various stages of planning or implementation. The MARINEWIND Labs will involve the Quintuple Helix stakeholders (industry, academia, public authorities, civil society and green innovation). The threefold analysis will be conveyed into the MARINEWIND web based Geographical Information System (webGIS) which will provide specifically tailored information on FOWT to the various stakeholders on the basis of their category, geographical location and their goals and policy recommendations on how to have more informed RES policy and how to increase societal acceptance (WP4). The Replicability Plan will support the transfer of knowledge. Dissemination, Communication and Exploitation activities (WP5) will assure widespread outreach of the projects’ results and outcomes and to reach its impacts.
project.title: Market Uptake Measures of Floating Offshore Wind Technology Systems (FOWTs)
project.keywords: Floating Offshore Wind Technology, co-creation, environmental impact, market analysis, social acceptance, regulations

article.title: Preparing for more offshore wind energy

result.title: Project Management Plan
result.description: Project Management plan including a description of the Gantt chart and a Work Breakdown Structure WBS schedule per task responsible partnerrelated subtasks related deliverables and dependencies on other tasks It includes a quality procedure for the project deliverables and outputsLinked to task 61

result.title: Networking with other projects and initiatives Report - First reporting period
result.description: This deliverable collect and analyse all the activities carried on with other relevant projects. It is linked to Task 5.3

result.title: Strategic Exploitation Plan - Strategy
result.description: The deliverable describes the strategy to exploit all the assets that will be produced in the project. Linked to Task 5.4.

result.title: Final Financial and techno-economic analysis
result.description: The deliverable identifies the main financial, technological and market barriers and enablers to invest in FOWT and the role of hybrid technologies in potentially mitigating some of these barriers. Linked to Task 3.4.

result.title: Analysis of technological barriers and enablers
result.description: The deliverable analyses the technological solutions tailored to the specific marine area. Linked to Task 3.2.

result.title: MARINEWIND Survey analysis Report - Second version
result.description: The deliverable contains the analysis of the surveys collected during the second reporting period and assesses the current collaboration between technology providers, financial institutions and local authorities. Linked to Task 3.3.

result.title: Meetings reports - Second period
result.description: The deliverable contains all the information related to the meetings organised by the Coordinator during the period 12-24 M. Linked to Task 6.1.

result.title: Final social acceptance and environmental impact analysis
result.description: The deliverable quantifies the impact of the environmental issues and social acceptance on the development of FOWT technologies. Linked to Task 2.2.

result.title: Meetings reports - First period
result.description: The deliverable contains all the information related to the meetings organised by the Coordinator during the first 12 months of the project. Linked to Task 6.1.

result.title: Final policy framework analysis
result.description: The deliverable tries to quantify the impact of policy and regulatory barriers and enablers on the development of FOWT technologies. Linked to Task 1.4.

result.title: Analysis of financial and market barriers and enablers
result.description: The deliverable analyses the broad knowledge base of market situations of renewable energy, in particular in the FOWT sector. Linked to Task 3.1.

result.title: Ethical issues Reports
result.description: The deliverable contains all the information related to the management of the collected personal data during the implementation of the project Linked to Task 63

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Activities Report - Second period
result.description: This deliverable collect all the Communication and Dissemination activities implemented by the partners during the period.

result.title: MARINEWIND Survey analysis Report - First version

result.title: Analysis of policy and regulatory barriers and enablers
result.description: The deliverable asseses key aspects related to wholesale market designs and market development pathways at international level, policy and regulation framework at Labs and European level, to enable the wider uptake of FOWT for a long term market vision. Linked to Task 1.1, 1.2 and 1.3.

result.title: Analysis of social and environmental barriers and enablers

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
